dataset.title: Dataset: Tidal and nontidal marsh restoration: a trade-off between carbon sequestration, methane emissions, and soil accretion
dataset.abstract: Soil cores were collected at wetlands that had been restored for a minimum of 10 years with managed hydrology in Twitchell and Sherman Islands in the western portion of the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta, California. The goal of the study was to measure soil carbon accumulation rates since restoration for comparison with multiyear net atmospheric carbon exchange measured by eddy covariance towers. Soil cores were sliced at 1 to 3 cm-thick intervals and analyzed for bulk density, organic matter, organic and inorganic carbon, total nitrogen and their stable isotopes, and 210Pb specific activities. Emergent vegetation was present at the sites. Dominant species at the core locations included Schoenoplectus acutus, Typha sp, and Phragmites sp. This dataset accompanies the paper Arias-Ortiz et al. under consideration in JGR: Biogeosciences.
dataset.intellectualRights: This dataset is listed under a Creative Commons BY 4.0 and can be used with attribution. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: A device that extrudes core into tube upward with a plunger

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were separated from soil before dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether or not sediment was sieved prior to carbon measurements.

codeDefinition.definition: Sediment was sieved prior to analysis for organics

attribute.attributeDefinition: If sediment was sieved, the size of sieve used.
Code indicating how the authors qualified or quantified compaction of the core.

codeDefinition.definition: Compaction was quantified and corrected for in core based measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density. This can include either samples that were freeze dried or oven dried.
Temperature at which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Time over which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Code indicating whether fraction carbon was measured or estimated as a function of organic matter.

codeDefinition.definition: Fraction carbon was measured as opposed to modeled

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether or not carbonates were removed prior to calculating fraction organic carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed before measuring organic carbon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The method used to remove carbonates prior to measuring fraction carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed using direct application of dilute acid

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method for which fraction carbon was measured or modeled (Note: regression based models are permitted, but the use of the Bemmelen factor [0.58 gOC gOM-1] is discouraged).

codeDefinition.definition: Each sample presented was measured using Elemental Analysis

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction_carbon refers to organic or total carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any other submitter defined notes describing methodologies for determining dry bulk density, organic matter fraction, and carbon fraction.
Code indicating the method used for determining lead 210 activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Alpha counting method used
Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the mass or accretion rate used in the excess_pb_210_model

codeDefinition.definition: Excess 210Pb modeled using mass accumulation rate

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the model used to estimate accumulation rates and/or age-depth chronologies.

codeDefinition.definition: A box model approach similar to the CRS model was used, but missing excess 210Pb inventories had to be inferred from historic wetland soils in the same area. The box model was based on the annual atmospheric flux of 210Pbxs estimated for the area and calculated from the mean 210Pbxs inventory of six dated intact wetland soils in a nearby location. We confirmed our estimate with data from direct measurements of 210Pbxs atmospheric deposition in artificial collectors in Berkeley, California. The box model was applied to calculate the 210Pbxs inventory (It) expected to have accumulated since restoration (t) at each site. Through this method we could locate the year of restoration (known date) in our soil depth profiles, which was equivalent to the depth at which these inventories (It) were met. A publications using a similar approach is: Marbà et al. 2015

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the assumption used to estimate the core's supported 226Ra specific activities.

codeDefinition.definition: 226Ra measured by spectrometry at selected samples along the soil profile.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any submitter defined notes elaborating on the process of dating the core not yet made clear by the coding.
Code indicating the reference or 0 year of the age depth model.

codeDefinition.definition: Year zero is set as the core's collection year.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Code indicated the method used for determining radium 226 activity

codeDefinition.definition: Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observations or measurement indicating dominant wetland vegetation type.

codeDefinition.definition: Describes wetlands dominated by persistent emergent vascular plants

attribute.attributeDefinition: Core identification code unique to each site.
Year of core collection
Month of core collection
Day of core collection
Positional latitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Positional longitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Code indicating how latitude and longitude were determined.

codeDefinition.definition: Any other technique resulting in positional error < 30 meters

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how latitude and longitude were determined.
Any relevant submitter generated notes on how elevation was determined

Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating average annual salinity (Note: Palustrine and freshwater should only include tidal wetlands, or wetlands that are potentially/formerly tidal but artificially freshened due to artificial tidal restrictions).

codeDefinition.definition: <0.5 ppt

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether vegetation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Vegetation inferred by field observation

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating how often the coring location is inundated.

codeDefinition.definition: Study-specific definition of a relatively low elevation zone behind a levee.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicated whether or not the coring team believes they recovered a full sediment profile, down to bedrock, or other non-marsh interface.

codeDefinition.code: core depth limited by length of corer
codeDefinition.definition: The total depth of the core was limited by the length of the coring device

attribute.attributeDefinition: Site identification code unique to each study.

Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Sample identification unique to the core. This should be used in the case that there are relevant lab specific sample codes, or in the case that there are multiple replicate samples.
Dry mass per unit volume of a soil sample. This does not include ash free bulk density.
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with total_pb210_activity.
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for Radium 226 (226Ra) if measured as part of the 210Pb dating process.
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with ra226_activity.
Excess radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with excess_pb210_activity.
The isotopic signature of 13C. This is oftentimes measured along with c14_age and can be useful for analyzing carbon lability and provenance.
Site identification code unique to each study.

Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Internal diamater of corer
Slice net wet weight
Slice net dry weight (dried at 60 C until constant weight)
Water content calculated as wet weight - dry weight/wet weight
Cumulative soil dry mass to inferior cm at each layer
Cumulative soil dry mass to center cm at each layer
Mass of organic matter relative to sample dry mass estimated using loss on ignition at 550 C during 5h
Carbonate content estimated using loss on ignition at 950 C during 2h
Estimated using LOI% to Corg% relationship: Corg% = 0.513*LOI%-1.9
Mass of nitrogen relative to sample dry mass quantified using elemental analyzer after sample acidification
Cabon to nitrogen atomic or molar ratio (not mass ratio)
The isotopic signature of 15N
Total specific activity per unit dry weight
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with k40_activity
Max depth of the sample increment, after correcting for compression during coring
Core identification code unique to each site.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Code indicating any major anthropogenic impacts historically and currently affecting the coring location.

codeDefinition.definition: Water level is raised artificially by a tidal restriction, resulting in ponding of water on the wetland and or upland surface

unit.description: grams per square meter per year

unit.description: one month excluding leap seconds and leap days, 2628000 seconds
